body:
Sure, I took them out for now.

As for the remaining changes, I managed to clean up quite a bit. There are still a few areas where classes with all static methods are initialized, specially in *Panel components I think and I'll try to handle them separately in subsequent pull requests. This should be ready to merge as far as I can tell.
Thanks again for your work @mmoayyed !
Thanks @mmoayyed - adjusting Oracle stuff was on my TODO list since long time :+1:

I am afraid it's not that simple; as many other interfaces throughout the whole codebase, this one is meant to be managed via an [implementation](https://ci.apache.org/projects/syncope/master/reference-guide.html#implementations).

FYI the application logic for this implementation is located at https://github.com/apache/syncope/blob/master/ext/saml2sp/logic/src/main/java/org/apache/syncope/core/logic/SAML2SPLogic.java#L298-L307
Makes sense, sure. I'll revert.
@mmoayyed does it work for you locally? Travis CI keeps failing: https://travis-ci.org/apache/syncope/jobs/588385015
Seeing this, yes. Fixing...
Thanks @mmoayyed Travis CI is now green :+1:
Great job @mmoayyed, thanks!
@mmoayyed I am not sure of the benefits of adding this: would you mind initiating a `[DISCUSS]` thread on dev@ on the topic? Thanks!
Based on discussions on the dev mailing list, we're going to punt this one.
FTR: https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/1b782cbac24508fd7de96aabafd9ee198e8f3785a446bb016ef8fbd7@%3Cdev.syncope.apache.org%3E
It seems Travis CI is failing: https://travis-ci.org/apache/syncope/jobs/591982376#L725-L727

@mmoayyed it seems that [Travis CI](https://travis-ci.org/apache/syncope/jobs/592984632) keeps failing by timeout in integration tests (I manually restarted that job three times, always same result).
It also seems that [AppVeyor](https://ci.appveyor.com/project/ApacheSoftwareFoundation/syncope/builds/27850310) shows similar troubles: can you figure out why? I think your local build is successful, no?

Hmmm strange. I'll run this one more time locally but yes mine seems to pass. It's possible CI is somehow running out of memory and hanging but I can't imagine that would be because of the changes here. I'll report back shortly.

Update: Had to invalidate caching to let maven resume ITs and now I see the failures. Most are failing due to executor fields being `null` for various task types, or areas where executor is not calculated or set. Been working to make further progress and fix test cases, and there is still quite a bit of work to make sure all ITs can pass.

Cleaning up tests; I have had to simulate an authentication context for ReportITCase and ReportTemplateITCase specially to make sure executions have a valid executor now that the field is marked as non-null. Still testing.

Waiting for CI to pass; I think in theory, this patch does also handle accounting for executors for tasks as well. I will nonetheless take a separate pass to make sure and follow-up with another PR if necessary.

Last failure was quite strange:

```
[INFO] BUILD FAILURE
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Total time:  02:31 min (Wall Clock)
[INFO] Finished at: 2019-10-07T13:07:37Z
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-compiler-plugin:3.8.1:testCompile (default-testCompile) on project syncope-fit-core-reference: Compilation failure
[ERROR] /home/travis/build/apache/syncope/fit/core-reference/src/test/java/org/apache/syncope/fit/core/ReportITCase.java:[99,35] cannot find symbol
[ERROR]   symbol:   method getLastExecutor()
[ERROR]   location: variable reportTO of type org.apache.syncope.common.lib.to.ReportTO
```

I wonder if this is due to caching on Travis CI. Started the CI again with an empty commit to make sure...

@mmoayyed LGTM 

+1 to go ahead and "squash and merge"
Hum, I see now errors in the Console tests...

I think I still have to figure out issues with webjars. There are a lot of errors in the logs when I run FITs that I am not sure if all are relevant, but there are a few entries related to webjars that are concerning. Also I am seeing things like:

```
[ERROR]   AnyObjectsITCase.editPrinter:119 path: 'body:content:body:container:content:tabbedPanel:panel:searchResult:outerObjectsRepeater:0:outer:form:content:form' does not exist for page: ExceptionErrorPage
```

What does this mean exactly? that the operation went wrong and we landed on some sort of error page?

> What does this mean exactly? that the operation went wrong and we landed on some sort of error page?

Exactly.
When you browse that page in the real Admin Console, trying to replicate the steps in the test case, does it work?

@DmitriyBrashevets Travis CI is failing: https://travis-ci.org/apache/syncope/builds/595621147?utm_source=github_status&utm_medium=notification

Please check and fix, thanks.

@DmitriyBrashevets please also:
1. create an improvement on JIRA for this work
1. change your commit message to include the full JIRA number (e.g. `[SYNCOPE-150X]`)

thanks.

> @DmitriyBrashevets please also:
> 
> 1. create an improvement on JIRA for this work
> 2. change your commit message to include the full JIRA number (e.g. `[SYNCOPE-150X]`)
> 
> thanks.

Done
Thanks for creating SYNCOPE-1502.
Looks like I have test failures in **syncope-fit-core-reference**. @ilgrosso , could you please assist?
@DmitriyBrashevets I am making some adjustments, expect a merge soon

I added a [second commit](68cfc0d44b79539a28e36b5322d444a9b1a7d7cc) - to keep yours untouched - where:

1. I fixed few checkstyle violations (you'll have to build from root folder via `mvn clean install` to perform all necessary checks that Travis CI mostly skips, due to timing constraints)
1. I removed one-line, single-use methods
1. I verified, by running the whole integration test suite against the different environments via the various IT profiles under `fit/core-reference/pom.xml` - the compatibility of your changes with:
    * PostgreSQL
    * MySQL
    * PostgreSQL JSONB
    * MySQL JSON (which for some reason did not like the new `getAdminRealmsFilter()`, so I had to keep it old-style just for it)
    * Elasticsearch

All works fine, thanks @DmitriyBrashevets for your contribution.
Build https://travis-ci.org/apache/syncope/builds/595974719 is fine, and the only afterward change is ad10777071307042e448838d3740591f6c83f461 - no need to wait, let's merge.

Thanks @naofum , glad to see you are still contributing!
Please consider submitting an ICLA, if you haven't before: http://syncope.apache.org/contributing#How_do_I_become_a_contributor_or_a_committer.3F
@naofum do you think it is possible for you to send another PR against branch `2_1_X`?
Thansk, I will prepare PR against branch 2_1_X
Thanks for your contribution @naofum !
Thanks @FedericoPalmitesta for spotting this!
Thanks @FedericoPalmitesta for spotting this!
If not done yet, please consider submitting your [ICLA](http://syncope.apache.org/contributing#How_do_I_become_a_contributor_or_a_committer.3F), thanks again.
@coheigea Travis CI is fine, please go ahead and merge, thanks.
Thank you @FedericoPalmitesta !
Thanks @FedericoPalmitesta !
Going to add a few more test cases based on Groups, etc but this should be essentially ready for further reviews.
LGTM please @mmoayyed go ahead, squash and merge, thanks!
It seems, everything should be resolved now.
Thanks @DmitriyBrashevets !
I have done some additional cleanup, and am going to test the create/update scenarios some more tomorrow.

I have added a few more adjustments to clean up code and have also work through the NPE issues, etc. Tested the batch with created-only audit entries and those with history. Comparisons/updates also should now sanitize sensitive data for user objects, and use the correct object for diffs.
This is G2G.
@mmoayyed LGTM please go ahead, squash and merge

`jstl` is currently used by

* https://github.com/apache/syncope/blob/master/ext/saml2sp/agent/src/main/resources/META-INF/resources/saml2sp/loginSuccess.jsp
* https://github.com/apache/syncope/blob/master/ext/oidcclient/agent/src/main/resources/META-INF/resources/oidcclient/loginSuccess.jsp

hence if you want to remove it, you'll have to include in this PR the changes for such two JSPs.

Moreover, you should also include removal of https://github.com/apache/syncope/blob/master/standalone/LICENSE#L931
Moreover, scope is `provided`, hence nothing is actually shipped with release artifacts, no?
Maybe a better fix then would be to replace it with taglibs-standard-impl (leaving it as provided)?

> Maybe a better fix then would be to replace it with taglibs-standard-impl (leaving it as provided)?

Do you mean https://search.maven.org/artifact/org.apache.taglibs/taglibs-standard-impl/1.2.5/bundle ? Sure.

Still, the `LICENSE` entry mentioned above should be also updated.
@ilgrosso OK I modified the PR, please check again

LGTM.
Please go ahead, squash and merge.
@ilgrosso Thanks. I'll leave it up to you if you want to cherry-pick it or not

Thanks @coheigea ; cherry-picked with 469c3b30cd1cabeec6869a022a31c2d51c158c8a on `2_1_X` and ffb62885224d9eb680171f9454113bb92851dc0b on `2_0_X`

Please notice that on both branches JSTL is effectively included in the artifacts.

Did you already submit your [ICLA](http://syncope.apache.org/contributing#How_do_I_become_a_contributor_or_a_committer.3F)?

From Travis CI perspective, things are working but it seems there is something to adjust.
Thanks @Dodoveloper !

FYI I made some small adjustments in cb2e29f3be8735c86e5b8e819492a2225e0e0751 and cherry-picked to `master` branch as 4821d51b4cd155377b35d3807cb7da7254d1d59c and b78c7e6ef9d4c94ec0f0966ab26be42b43fce095
Perfect. Shall I close out this one?
I think so, yes. Thanks.
This should be ready to merge, unless there are further changes required. I can also take a pass at writing wicket tests for the new screen to merge accounts, if that is appropriate.

Thanks @mmoayyed , code looks ok but I would like to take it out for few smoke tests.

> I can also take a pass at writing wicket tests for the new screen to merge accounts, if that is appropriate.

This would be really appreciated, thanks.
~~Been working on tests; still WIP~~; This should also be done.
LGTM thanks @Dodoveloper
FYI Wicket 9.0.0-M4 was recently released.

@mmoayyed I have been running this PR and have the following notes:

1. the new Merge Accounts modal window's footer is too high, there might be something weird with modal setup
1. modal window's title should mention the receiving user for merge, e.g. the one that was initially selected
1. all users but the receiving user should be good candidates to be selected for merge, regardless they have linked accounts or not
1. some kind of preview feature before commit is desirable: consider that such operation is going to remove a user, hence admins should be adequately warned
1. what about using https://fontawesome.com/v4.7.0/icon/compress as menu icon?

Thanks!

Thanks much for the review. Quick progress report:

> the new Merge Accounts modal window's footer is too high, there might be something weird with modal setup

Fixed in most recent commits.

> modal window's title should mention the receiving user for merge, e.g. the one that was initially selected

Done.

> all users but the receiving user should be good candidates to be selected for merge, regardless they have linked accounts or not

WIP. 

> some kind of preview feature before commit is desirable..

WIP.

> what about using fontawesome.com/v4.7.0/icon/compress as menu icon?

Sure, done.

I am going to continue with improving the merge process, and follow-up tests. Should be able to finalize by early next week.

Progress report:

- Cleaned up the wizard, and added additional screens/panels for resource selection and review of final linked accounts.
- Clean up panel to demonstrate list of resources available for selection for the target user, turning into a linked-account itself.
- More refactoring and small UI fixes.
- Fix issues with cancel and finish buttons in the wizard.
- Add additional text/summaries to explain intent of panels.

TODOs:

- Item selection via context/action menus should trigger a "next" event to the next panel.
- Disallow navigating to the next panel if previous panel is incomplete state. (select merging user before showing resources, etc)
- Add data to final review panel to preview linked accounts 
- Execute merge-account functionality once the wizard is in complete state.
- Clean up tests.

Thanks @mmoayyed for status update; one item is not clear to me:

> Item selection via context/action menus should trigger a "next" event to the next panel.

Why? The Admin UI is plenty of wizard steps where a single selection is required to proceed to next step (see Group edit with user owner selection, for example) - yet, nowhere selection triggers wizard's advance.

I was hoping to do this with one click less than expected; For example, when the list of users are displayed one would have to click on a user entry in the list, click select from the action menu, *and* then click next to advance to the next panel. It would be more ideal to have the select menu trigger a next event automatically, removing the need for the user to additionally click the next button. However, if that behavior is acceptable and is consistent with everywhere else, I can keep it as is.

I understand the proposed improvement; however, I'd drop it for the moment as this PR is already quite considerable.

Anyway, we can always keep if for the future as general improvement, since as said above, there might be other places where the same could be applied.
Thanks @DmitriyBrashevets

@DmitriyBrashevets I had to push another commit to fix checkstyle violations that triggered build errors - see 15bc95cf7be0ddd90a26e6285b84ddd8069edb1a .
Please keep this into account for future contributions, thanks.

This should be almost done from a functional point of view. I have added additional panels to show a list of resources, available for selection that would be used for to-be-merged user, and I have also added a panel in the wizard as a final review of all linked accounts. I have also polished the code a bit to handle event sinking for cancel/finish events to handle modal dialog issues as well as the actual merge step. 

I'd appreciate a code review, specially on the final merge step to make sure linked accounts are correctly constructed.

What remains is as follows:

1. Have to clean up the integration tests for merged accounts

2. Need to figure out how to add checks for each panel to prevent from advancing to the next step in the wizard if selections (user, resource, etc) are not met. I have not found a good example on this, and did experiment with callbacks such as `applyState` and `isComplete` in the wizard, but none is ideal. Is there a good reference on how this might be done? or shall I drop this bit for now, with the assumptions that admin user driving the wizard would make the right selections before moving onto the next step.

> @DmitriyBrashevets I had to push another commit to fix checkstyle violations that triggered build errors - see [15bc95c](https://github.com/apache/syncope/commit/15bc95cf7be0ddd90a26e6285b84ddd8069edb1a) .
> Please keep this into account for future contributions, thanks.

Ok, thanks

I don't think it is a good idea to duplicate the validation check - which is performed by the Core for all entities, including User.
Furthermore, please consider that username values can be invalid not only because of illegal characters, but also because of one or more Account Policies defined, which can't be evaluated by Admin Console anyway.
Anyway, I have opened SYNCOPE-1534 for similar purpose.
Thanks for the feedback. Lets refocus on SYNCOPE-1534 then.

When I run `mvn clean verify` under `core/provisioning-api` I get the following errors:

```
[ERROR] Failures: 
[ERROR]   FormatUtilsTest.formatDoubleNumber:64 expected: <1.580.129.038.642> but was: <1,580,129,038,642>
[ERROR]   FormatUtilsTest.formatLongNumber:54 expected: <1.580.129.038.632> but was: <1,580,129,038,632>
```

Maybe there is something locale-dependent?

@mmoayyed I still haven't find enough time to properly look at actual feature, just browsed the proposed code changes, sorry.

Also, please apply the changes in [rebase.txt](https://github.com/apache/syncope/files/4117301/rebase.txt) to rebase this PR with latest changes from `2_1_X`.

Thank you for the reviews so far. I will begin to address the feedback and will also rebase.

There is still the matter of finishing integration tests, but I would like to hold off on that for now until the functionality is ready to minimize work as much as possible.
I guess so, it should be good now.

```
[ERROR] Tests run: 5, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.08 s <<< FAILURE! - in org.apache.syncope.core.provisioning.api.utils.FormatUtilsTest
[ERROR] formatLongNumber  Time elapsed: 0.011 s  <<< FAILURE!
org.opentest4j.AssertionFailedError: expected: <1.580.389.384.884> but was: <1,580,389,384,884>
        at org.apache.syncope.core.provisioning.api.utils.FormatUtilsTest.formatLongNumber(FormatUtilsTest.java:61)
```

Will cherry-pick into master.
Change is now ported to master as well via https://github.com/apache/syncope/commit/763a2542e2c200ff3750100ba690b1f0effae4ec
Thanks!

I am going to begin to work on tests; all other feedback should be accounted for, and I have also added changes to handle the highlighting of the selected row during the user/resource selection process. (It works, it's not pretty, but I couldn't find any other other approach that would be compatible without breaking changes)
This should be good to go. Sorry for the delay; took me a to organize the tests to merge accounts.
Looks good! Please go ahead, squash and merge.
LGTM, please go ahead, squash and merge
